docs.snippet: The nation's top law officer called for dialogue with the tech industry, but also turned up the heat on Apple for refusing to help the FBI unlock an encrypted iPhone used by an extremist mass killer in San Bernardino....
docs.lead_paragraph: The nation's top law officer called for dialogue with the tech industry, but also turned up the heat on Apple for refusing to help the FBI unlock an encrypted iPhone used by an extremist mass killer in San Bernardino.

headline.main: Attorney General Turns Up the Heat in Public War With Apple
headline.print_headline: Attorney General Turns Up the Heat in Public War With Apple

docs.snippet: In their first comment on the arrest, the parents of Otto F. Warmbier said they hoped North Korea would free him after he admitted stealing a political banner....
docs.lead_paragraph: In their first comment on the arrest, the parents of Otto F. Warmbier said they hoped North Korea would free him after he admitted stealing a political banner.
docs.abstract: Parents of University of Virginia student Otto F Warmbier, detained in North Korea since January, hope his tearful apology broadcast on state television will prompt his release; have not heard from him since he was arrested during five-day tour of country.

headline.main: Parents of American Held in North Korea Unable to Speak With Him
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; North Korea: Parents Hope Apology Will Free Son

byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Choe Sang-Hun from Seoul. Gardiner Harris contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and CHOE SANG-HUN

docs.snippet: The U.S. government calls it a "vicious guard dog" that hurts national security. Apple says it's critical to protecting consumer privacy against increasingly sophisticated hackers....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. government calls it a "vicious guard dog" that hurts national security. Apple says it's critical to protecting consumer privacy against increasingly sophisticated hackers.

headline.main: FBI, Apple Clash Before Congress as Encryption Fight Simmers
headline.print_headline: FBI, Apple Clash Before Congress as Encryption Fight Simmers

docs.snippet: Intentionally or not, Mr. Trump’s campaign is mobilizing white supremacists, so much so that he has their support despite awkward attempts to publicly disavow it....
docs.lead_paragraph: Intentionally or not, Mr. Trump’s campaign is mobilizing white supremacists, so much so that he has their support despite awkward attempts to publicly disavow it.
docs.abstract: Republican presidential candidate Donald J Trump, whether intentional or not, is favorite among Ku Klux Klan members and other white supremacists, many of whom have traditionally refrained from participating in political process.

headline.main: Donald Trump’s Message Resonates With White Supremacists
headline.print_headline: Trump’s Message Resonates With White Supremacists
